stance_1: I choose meat that looks good while shopping
stance_2: I eat meat as a regular part of my diet
justification: Choosing meat that looks good while shopping supports the regular inclusion of meat in the diet.

stance_1: I eat meat as a regular part of my diet
stance_2: I eat meat when it is on my grocery list
justification: Eating meat when it is on the grocery list supports the regular consumption of meat as part of the diet.

stance_1: I eat meat as a regular part of my diet
stance_2: I sometimes eat plant-based meat due to others' preferences
justification: Regularly eating meat is in tension with occasionally eating plant-based meat due to others' preferences.

stance_1: I eat meat as a regular part of my diet
stance_2: Most people I eat with prefer regular meat
justification: The preference for regular meat among social contacts supports the interviewee's regular meat consumption.

stance_1: I change what I eat if my doctor suggests it
stance_2: I eat meat as a regular part of my diet
justification: Being open to changing diet based on doctor's advice may conflict with the regularity of meat consumption.

stance_1: I sometimes eat plant-based meat due to others' preferences
stance_2: Most people I eat with prefer regular meat
justification: Eating plant-based meat due to others' preferences is in tension with the majority's preference for regular meat.

stance_1: I sometimes eat plant-based meat due to others' preferences
stance_2: Some social contacts choose plant-based meat to lose weight
justification: Interviewee's occasional plant-based meat consumption is supported by social contacts motivated to eat plant-based for weight loss.

stance_1: I sometimes eat plant-based meat due to others' preferences
stance_2: Some social contacts choose organic foods for lifestyle change
justification: Eating plant-based meat due to others' preferences is supported by knowing people who choose organic foods for lifestyle reasons.

stance_1: I change what I eat if my doctor suggests it
stance_2: I choose meat that looks good while shopping
justification: Changing eating habits due to doctor's advice may conflict with spontaneous choices based on appearance.
